txt.en: 'Well-fought, [placeholder]! That was a dire fight, but we proved victorious.\n\n'I do not doubt the accuracy of Burnoth's report, but this battle only proves my will. The people of the Sutcrofts shall stand and defend their lands.'
'Alas, we have failed here. Let us return to Snowbourn.'
Instance: A Thirst for Blood
Burnoth has perished
Fastred has perished
Hutha has perished
Talk to Burnoth.
LÃ©ofdag has perished
Listen to the discussion between the Riders Four and Reeve Fastred.
Ulf has perished
Defeat the Orcs attacking Fastred's camp.
Ulf has perished
Defeat Zakrif, the troll-commander of the Orc-company.
Talk to Fastred.
'Indeed not. My folk are not cowards to run in the face of danger.'
'Long have we lived beneath the shadow of Orc-raids, and always have we fought them off.'
'If these Khundolar wish to spill their blood upon our spears, then I say let them. The Sutcrofts shall not fall to Orc or Easterling.'
'What is that? Something approaches!'
'Orcs! Come, my friends, let the blood flow!'
Talk to Burnoth
Listen to the discussion between the Riders Four and Reeve Fastred
Defeat the Orcs attacking Fastred's camp
Defeat Zakrif
Defeated Zakrif
Talk to Reeve Fastred
Fastred and the Riders Four must survive
'The ground is black with their blood! Wait... something else approaches... something large!'
You have accompanied the Riders Four to the camp of Reeve Fastred in the Sutcrofts in the hope of discussing the Khundolar invasion with him.
'Ah, my friends, you have arrived. I have told Reeve Fastred of the Easterlings coming from the north, but he will not relent....'
